item.title: Pothole 60 mm deep measuring 60 x 70 cm on Church Road Leckhampton, 18th February
item.description:
Church Road opposite house number 96. LHS if coming from Shurdington. Unavoidable if traffic coming the opposite way. Has caused damage to my wheel & tyre for which I will claim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain outside 70 Andover Rd, accumulation of leaf mould in gutter and associated flooding corner Hatherley st and Andover Rd, 18th February
item.description:
Drain has not been unblocked since last report; annual unblocking is UNACCEPTABLE; compacted leaves persist in and around the drain. Drain is permanently flooded. Blocked drain and poorly repaired camber on corner of Hatherley st and Andover Rd both result in almost permanent flooding on corner. Pavement has high pedestrian traffic and flooding is a serious problem for many elderly, people with children/prams/pushchairs and anyone who is unable to jump across the puddle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failed trench repair growing much deeper at the road centre, 18th February
item.description:
Location: across the carriageway opposite 72/74 Andover Rd and the entrance to Lypiatt Drive, Cheltenham. Photograph was taken last week - today estimate of trench depth at centre is 65-70cm. Last night multiple lorries, especially after 1am bumped very noisily over it; both grade 2 listed terraces either side of Hatherley St experience significant vibration when pothole is struck. SLEEP IS DISRUPTED Pothole is clearly detiriorating further with traffic and continuing rain. Pothole is rapidly becoming a danger especially to cyclists or motorcyclists who might be thrown onto the carriageway if they hit the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose paving slab with rodent activity under slabs, 18th February
item.description:
Alley to side of 2PIGS next to fire escape. broken slab with large cavity under. you can see the surface water drain pipe, but there is a large void around it that looks to be used by rodents. This is bringing potential rodent activity to the 2Pigs public house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
